lesson_title: Innovation Strategies for Electric Mobility: The StreetScooter Case
content_title: ['Introduction to Electric Mobility', 'Core Concepts', 'Strategic Implementation', 'Case Studies', 'Advanced Electric Mobility']
short_description: Help your organization develop the strategies needed to become a front-runner of innovation in electric mobility and beyond.
description: Learn about the tools and methods that can be employed to understand and identify customer needs as well as the processes that companies can set in place to foster and launch successful technological innovations. A special emphasis will be placed on analyzing how companies can benefit from entrepreneurial thinking to innovate more successfully and on understanding how they can build entire ecosystems around their products and services. The theoretical knowledge will be transferred and applied to a recent, highly successful technological innovation from Germany: The StreetScooter, an electric delivery vehicle of Deutsche Post DHL. This self-paced course consists of eight consecutive parts: The course will provide you with an in-depth understanding of the process of technology and innovation management. Specifically, the course will familiarize you with state-of-the-art tools, methods, and theories and help you understand how these may be used to solve and organize complex innovation challenges, placing a special emphasis on interdisciplinary thinking at the intersection of management and technology. After completing this course, you will improve your career qualifications as Business Development Manager , Change Manager or Innovation Manager.

lesson_title: Principles of Microeconomics: An Economist Way of Thinking
content_title: ['Introduction to of Microeconomics', 'Core Concepts', 'Strategic Implementation', 'Case Studies', 'Advanced of Microeconomics']
short_description: Explore the fundamentals of microeconomics including economic efficiency, scarcity and opportunity costs. This course will set you up to think like an economist and to identify how economics relates to the everyday choices we make.
description: Recent global economic and non-economic events have highlighted the importance of informed and well reasoned decision making of resource allocation and efficiency. This course focuses on how decision making units within the economy (e.g., consumers, firms, government departments) make choices and how choices can be made in a way that makes best possible use of limited available resources. Since life is in large part about making choices, this course will help you to understand why the world is the way it is, and in so doing, shed light on how it might be changed for the better. ****Firstly the course equips you to think and see the world like an economist. Topic areas include advancing your knowledge in comparative advantage and opportunity cost. The next area, supply and demand, focuses on how choices are made in a market system and how an economic system coordinates many rational choices of self-interested decision-makers. You will explore the application of economic theory and economic efficiency of competitive markets, as well as consumer and producer surplus and deadweight loss.This MOOC is part of the Professional Certificate in Microeconomics.

lesson_title: Sustainable Food Systems: A Mediterranean Perspective
content_title: ['Introduction to Food Systems', 'Theoretical Frameworks', 'Research Methods', 'Case Studies', 'Contemporary Food Systems']
short_description: How do we produce more, better quality, and safer food while simultaneously achieving social and environmental goals?
description: The Mediterranean region is one of the most biodiverse in the world, home to a complex and intricate patchwork of cultures, climates, and cuisines. Food systems in the region -- represented worldwide by the "Mediterranean diet" -- are equally complex, demanding analysis across the political, social, cultural, economic and nutritional spectrums from landscape to table.The ability of Mediterranean agriculture to sustain its peoples -- and the planet -- is now threatened by several issues:This course discusses the challenges and opportunities of the agricultural sector in the Mediterranean basin. It summarizes global-to-local challenges related to achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG); outlines the history and culture of agriculture and its main characteristics with a focus on the "Mediterranean diet"; explains agricultural data with a focus on rural development models and value creation; explores EU policy frameworks and international agreements related to food and agriculture in the Mediterranean; and highlights emerging opportunities linked to innovation and sustainability in the sector.This course is for:Want to learn more about sustainable food and nutrition around the world? Check out the SDG Academy course

lesson_title: Drones and Autonomous Systems 2: Applications in Emergency Management
content_title: ['Introduction to Autonomous Systems', 'Variables and Data Types', 'Control Structures', 'Functions and Methods', 'Advanced Autonomous Systems']
short_description: Learn the latest applications of unmanned aerial systems (UAS) in emergency management, public safety, and industry, as well as the potential risks UAS pose to safety and privacy.
description: If you want to be the technology specialist who can procure and gain insight into cutting edge systems to help save lives and cut disaster losses, this Professional Certificate provides the foundational knowledge you need. It is designed for recreational hobbyists, certified remote pilots, commercial operators, and public safety and government users. This course covers unmanned aerial systems (UAS) to include drones and autonomous aerial vehicles, sensors, communications, ground control, navigation and other payloads that rely on complex algorithms that can be applied for protecting and saving lives and property. In this edX Professional Certificate, you will learn the importance of autonomous systems and drone technologies that bring speed, efficiency and affordable solutions to disaster response and management. Topics include the use of drones by emergency managers, first responders, and search and rescue personnel responding to natural and manmade disasters. No previous knowledge of drones or flight experience is required. Join as you start your drone journey.
university: University of Maryland Global Campus-University System of Maryland

lesson_title: Cities and the Challenge of Sustainable Development
content_title: ['Introduction to Sustainable Development', 'Variables and Data Types', 'Control Structures', 'Functions and Methods', 'Advanced Sustainable Development']
short_description: What is a sustainable city? Learn the basics here.
description: According to the United Nations, urbanization and population growth could result in an increase of 2.5 billion people into urban populations by 2050, with associated impacts ranging from increased transportation needs to more building. How do we make cities sustainable to support this growth? In this mini-series, learn the challenges of local governments to adapt to new technologies, energy systems, modes of transportation and more in order to build the sustainable cities of the 21st century. This mini-series is a companion piece to the SDG Academy's full-length Sustainable Cities course. This course is for:  Environmental Studies

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Grammar','Sentence Structure']
short_description: Master the most common grammar topics appearing in TOEIC Part 5.
description: Covers verb forms, modifiers, connectors, clauses, and common error patterns. Students practice sentence-completion questions aligned with TOEIC exam logic.

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Grammar','Verbs']
short_description: Strengthen understanding of verbs, tenses, and agreement.
description: Focus on simple vs. progressive forms, perfect tenses, modal verbs, subjectverb agreement, and tense logic used in business contexts.

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Grammar','Prepositions']
short_description: Learn high-frequency TOEIC prepositions used in workplace contexts.
description: Practice location, time, movement, and phrasal preposition usage. Includes realistic fill-in-the-blank exercises based on email and memo situations.

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Grammar','Modifiers']
short_description: Improve clarity by placing modifiers correctly.
description: Covers adjective/adverb choice, participial phrases, reduced clauses, and common modifier errors frequently tested in Part 5.

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Grammar','Connectors']
short_description: Master connector words that determine sentence meaning.
description: Students learn logical connectors (however, therefore, although, meanwhile) and practice TOEIC-style questions testing sentence cohesion.

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Grammar','Clauses']
short_description: Understand complex sentence structures tested in TOEIC.
description: Practice who/whom/which/that, embedded clauses, subject/object clause identification, and typical distractors.

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Vocabulary','Business English']
short_description: Learn high-frequency collocations essential for TOEIC.
description: Focus on phrases used in meetings, schedules, logistics, finance, customer service, and HR. Includes MCQ-style fill-in-the-blank tasks.

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Vocabulary','Nouns']
short_description: Avoid common noun errors that appear frequently in Part 5.
description: Practice phrases like 'make progress', 'give advice', 'conduct research', and understand quantifiers such as much/many/less/fewer.

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Grammar','Conjunctions']
short_description: Build strong control of complex sentence structures.
description: Learn FANBOYS, subordinating conjunctions, and how conjunction choice changes sentence meaning in TOEIC questions.

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Vocabulary','Context Clues']
short_description: Identify meaning from surrounding words in TOEIC sentences.
description: Students learn inference skills, tone recognition, and how to eliminate distractors using context.

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Mock Test','Grammar']
short_description: Timed Part-5 style quizzes for real exam practice.
description: Includes sets of 1520 mixed grammar questions with analytics and explanations of common traps used in official TOEIC exams.

content_title: ['TOEIC Practice','Vocabulary','Idioms']
short_description: Understand idioms that frequently appear in business contexts.
description: Focus on expressions like 'ahead of schedule', 'in charge of', 'back up data', and more. Includes real-world MCQ practice.
